page.title: 07STOKE DOYLE CHURCH BELLS
page.content: In Stoke Doyle there are five bells.These range from the treble to the tenor. The bells are situated above the clock, with the bell-ropes situated in the belfry below. These bells are fairly easy to ring because they have new ropes and are very light.This tower has better facilities than Oundle although Oundle has more bells <8>. In the Oundle tower you have to climb lots of stairs to reach the ringing chamber. Also the Stoke Doyle bells are in places which are easy to see when ringing methods. The clock is a nuisance at Oundle as it ia in a awkward place in front of the number 2 bell. At Stoke Doyle the clock is above the chamber and so out of the way. All in all Stoke Doyle is a good place to go for a ring!
